title: So far, so not good
comment: Not helpful. Entering a=[1 2 1;2 3 1;3 3 3];b=[3;7;8];a\b yields "ERROR: DoubleNumberToken: divide: dimensions don't match. size(a) yields 3.000 3.000, size(b) yields 3.000 1.000. Entering a and b shows that they're assigned correctly. With identical input, Matlab (correctly) returns 3.667;0.333;-1.333.  This is literally the first thing I've tried with Addi. I imagine that there's something it does correctly and well but this is not at all encouraging.

title: My Favorite Productivity App, hands down
comment: As a physics major I have to do a lot of work with MatLab which isn't available for the android platform, much less my mobile phone.  I stumbled across this app completely by accident and it's been fantastic.  It's great for quick computations if you don't want to use the standard built-in calculator, it's got substantially more functions, can run .m files you've written on another phone or on an actual computer, and with the plotting and mapping packages available it's indispensable in a pinch if you're tr

title: Very promising

title: Awesome! However...
comment: This is an awesome app that functions exactly as you'd expect.  The only flaw is that, when using the custom keyboard, there is no obvious way to get out of parentheses. Add arrow keys to the keyboard to allow you to move within a line entry and this is a six-star app! In the mean time, use your default device keyboard to move around.

title: Better than Octave
comment: Addi puts Octave to shame. I had to do some work on my PC using Octave and it snagged on the ! operator, and doesn't show command suggestions like Addi does. This makes me love my Asus Slider all the  more.

title: Awesome
comment: While buying an android tablet, my friends discouraged me showing no efficient soft like matlab available. Now I can smile on them. This app is great but need to improve more. I more library files required along with better GUI. Hope the developer will give us a real alternative to matlab.

title: Very good

title: Poor custom keyboard
comment: I cannot even press 'up' with your default custom keyboard to repeat the last input Functions well, but need huge interface improvement

title: Gorgeous little app.
comment: It's nice to actually be able to do useful calculations mobile. Addi feels like running Octave from terminal, with the bonus of function mnemonics. It's easily as nice as Qalculate! Or SpeedCrunch on desktop, which is what I'm used to, and it's nice to have that functionality on a calculator-sized device when working with a scratchpad. I'm a new Android user, but this is the first app to make my Nexus 7 seem like a "real computer." Serious kudos. = )

title: Awesome! Needs mobile interface
comment: I really like this app on my tablet. However, there is no good way to recall your last command like with the up arrow on the desktop version. Suggest adding gesture support for that.

title: Do serious math on your mobile
comment: A must have for advanced numerical computing and visualization (with addiplot), faaaar more powerful than a number of apps you pay for. Works all right on my samsung galaxy note, even advanced octave commands are present. Wonderful! Excelent work.

title: Outstanding!
comment: Corbin is advancing this app on leaps and bounds. I managed to run a rather complex octave based dynamic energy budget model on my android tablet with no problems. This app is a must for anyone doing modelling in octave or matlab.

title: Awesome that this exists
comment: Thanks for doing this project. There's still a way to go, but the basics are all there and this app has come in handy more than once when I couldn't access the desktop version.  Also, it's incredible how well this runs on the mobile platform given its limitations.  Again, thanks for doing this, you're doing an amazing job.

comment: and I cant believe someone has decided to take up the task of porting something as powerful as MATLAB to android. I'm really excited to see how far this goes. keep up the good work.

title: This is the power of smartphones

title: Great application

comment: Awesome! Good start to something that can become great! Just needs more functions.

title: To the author: encouragement and thanks!
comment: Thank you for helping me use this hand held computer for something actually useful. Addi is a great asset to android. To the community: before you downrank this app, remember that this is essentially a one-man show trying to imitate two decades worth of professionally produced software in his free time. Addi is open source, so if you're dissatisfied with the function library, consider contributing your own code to the project.

title: fft, fast fourier transform
comment: I love this initiative, have used it a lot already!!  The fft routine is however not compatible whit Octave and Matlab. It only delivers a REAL onesided fourier spectrum instead of the full twosided COMPLEX fft obtained from Octave and Matlab. This means that all phase info is lost in the frequency domain. I tried to work aruond this by instead  using straight-forward  matrix multiplication with the slow DFT matrix (256x256 buth addi then freezes. Are the memory limitations too harsh??  I would also love a simple interpolating routine, such as interp1.  Otherwise most happy with it

title: Awesome.
comment: I love to have this app in my pocket ;)

Excellent app. I have managed to run fairly complex Matlab scripts with minimal modifications! Great effort.

title: Very Nice!
comment: Unlike some of the others, I recognize this for what it is, this is a person that is providing us a wonderful tool to do things that most other scientific calculators cannot do on a phone. The ability to do matrix math, and run scripts is great. I would love to see it continue to advance. Here are my suggestions. Use hidden windows to have a variables list/previous called functions on the left, and on the top or right, ability to change the working directory. Perhaps have that come up under the menu
Great to be able to use all the computing power in my phone for something useful. GUI with easy entry of common signs/numbers would be handy

title: Works well
comment: Really great app ! Matrices, loops, plotting (via Addiplot)... awesome !
Great! Similar basic syntax to matlab/octave. Would be 5 stars if there was a way to create fn/scripts. Ui with common symbols (e.g. =) would be nice.
Great app. Would appreciate a GUI though.
Awesome for when Matlab is nowhere in sight... I finally feel safe leaving the house without a laptop ;)
A must for engineers. It is great to be able to grow out of the TI-like sci calcs on the market and into real computing tools.
Good concept and shows a lot of promise for the future... Should add scripting functionality and a more useful math keyboard. Waiting for updates! :)
Needs the ability to write/save/load scripts in an editor window of some kind.
How do you type an equals sign in?
First step of a great approach. At least a help command to show a list of supported functions is needed. Personally I really need the randn function.
Very good effort. Request fcn list and transfer function capabilities
I could not figure out how to the app. Need function list and more support
How to load mfile or specify directory?
An ambitious idea, but a long way from Matlab. Says it can run m-files but no idea how to do that.
Nice effort and working good on samsumg galaxy s
Nice but not practical for mobile phones. You must find another way to enter input.
Good start but has many problems. Every time I open addi font size gets smaller until I can't read anything anymore...
Good start
Good idea, but. . . Bad interface, no functions help, deat lock in complex calcs, no preferece menu, for example: font size, mantisa, colors, history
This is excellent so far. Would it have been easier to do a server version like matlab did for iphone? A keyboard would also be an excellent additon.
Amazing program that shows a lot of promise of becoming the Malta of the Android.
I applaud this effort. Very early yet but shows great promise. Would love to see a built-in editor to compose/run .m files. Kudos for a good start!
cool IDEA but the functions u want matlab for don't exist
